data.text: @WAPFLondon Thanks very much, you've been very helpful.  I will let you know how I get on.
@LNPFRL See SS v Richmond [2021] EWCOP 31 https://t.co/e52BT21kzi

@LNPFRL I advocate a campaign to amend s.27 to stop the court interfering with LPA decisions, this is an absurd situation and I am sorry you have to go through this. Best argument to make other than Montgomery is that Father was against vaccines.

@LNPFRL that ignores that the duty of care is to consider all material risks as in Montgomery's case, which overturned the Bolam test relying on "the responsible body of medical opinion". Your defence is they are negligent by not following Montgomery. https://t.co/0yMP6ArdMg https://t.co/tqFz4PjLWb

@LNPFRL The mental capacity act doesn't have a provision preventing the court from interfering with LPA decisions, which is absurd given that the court controls who is a LPA. They will claim your decision is against best interests for not following government guidance but,,
@nuala1990 Hi, here is your unroll: https://t.co/uczkM4669U See you soon. 🤖
@WAPFLondon I have withdrawn consent for my Dad to be boosted - I have full LPA - GPs are reporting me and want to apply to OPG to override. Does this mean they can't?

@WAPFLondon @OPGGovUK @GOVUK Keep on them Weston A Price👏

People need to answer for the damage they've done and face the consequences, that's the only way we're able to try and prevent this madness happening again

With neither the Mental Capacity Act (2005) nor the Clinical Trial Regulations (2004) defining "Research Project" the courts must provide it the widest possible definition. Who could genuinely deny that COVID-19 emergency authorisation does not involve any research projects?
